common_errors.meaning: Translation key not found in any loaded namespace
causes: Namespace not loaded or wrong namespace specified
JSON file not found or failed to load
Key exists in default language but not in current language
solutions: Check key spelling matches JSON file exactly
Ensure namespace is loaded with useTranslation('namespace')
Verify JSON file path in backend configuration
Add missing key to translation files
Use fallbackLng to handle missing translations gracefully

common_errors.pattern: i18next::backendConnector: loading namespace .* for language .* failed
common_errors.meaning: Failed to fetch translation file from backend
causes: Translation file does not exist at expected path
CORS issues when loading from different origin
solutions: Check loadPath pattern matches your file structure: loadPath: '/locales/{{lng}}/{{ns}}.json'
Verify file exists at runtime path (check browser network tab)
Configure CORS headers on server serving translation files
Use addResourceBundle for bundled translations in production

common_errors.pattern: React-i18next:: You will need to pass in an i18next instance
common_errors.meaning: i18next not initialized before using useTranslation hook
solutions: Wrap app with I18nextProvider: <I18nextProvider i18n={i18n}>
Use Suspense or wait for i18next.init() promise
Call i18n.init() in application entry point before ReactDOM.render()

common_errors.meaning: Variable in translation string not provided
causes: Forgot to pass interpolation values to t() function
Typo in variable name between translation and code
solutions: Pass values: t('greeting', { name: userName })
Ensure variable names match: 'Hello {{name}}' needs { name: 'value' }
Use defaultValue for optional interpolations
Ensure component is inside I18nextProvider tree
Use useSuspense: false and handle loading state
Add Suspense boundary: <Suspense fallback='Loading...'>

common_errors.meaning: Translation files reference each other or configuration creates loop
causes: Namespace A references namespace B which references A
solutions: Restructure namespaces to avoid cross-references
Load shared keys in common namespace
Review plugin initialization order
Add all required plural forms: key_one, key_other (English); key_one, key_few, key_many, key_other (Russian)
Ensure count is numeric: t('items', { count: Number(value) })
Add pluralization polyfill for older browsers

common_errors.meaning: Attempting to use language before resources loaded
causes: Changed language without loading resources first
preload option doesn't include target language
solutions: Add to preload array: preload: ['en', 'de', 'fr']
Await changeLanguage: await i18n.changeLanguage('de')
Check backend connector for lazy loading errors
